content: Uses the wrong location, and yes location is turned on.  Other apps, including weather  follow my phone. 3/11/17 The folks at ECN, LLC suggested, "Likely the issue you experienced just requires a refresh to ensure your GPS is updated."  It is not just a matter or refreshing.  I've refreshed everything several times.  I've rebooted my phone several times.  I've uninstalled and reinstalled the app.  For whatever reason, it just doesn't seem to know where I am.  I rarely drive across the river in the area where I get all the warnings, and I've never received a warning for where I do live.  Perhaps the app just doesn't work well with the Galaxy Note 5.  I ended up deleting the app and have to leave the 1 star rating!
replyContent: Thank you for your review.  Likely the issue you have experienced just requires a refresh to ensure your GPS signal is updated.   The app is geo-aware and will provide you free alerts as you travel through an impacted area based upon your physical location.

content: Hello, bought realtime forever alert, still have ads in my app and no idea how to enable expensive realtime alert system. HELP PLEASE.

app_name: Earthquake Network - Realtime alerts

content: Paid for PRO. Getting molested every 10 minutes, even with phone in do not disturb mode. I've spent an estimated two cumulative hours trying to fine tune alerts. Should be straight forward. No. 4 rapid loud alarms with a cryptic message "earthquake network alert sound". Yeah, I get it. I can't sleep. I should be getting alerts for only a big one. Uninstalling... :-(
replyContent: Hi Mark, you probably enabled the alert on smartphone vibration. You can disable it or set a lower sensor sensitivity if the smartphone is in a "noisy" environment.
app_name: Earthquake Network - Realtime alerts

content: With each event, at first it reads one magnitude, then several hours later updates to the correct measurement (via USGS data). For example: at 0349 this morning, there was an earthquake registered in Oklahoma. Your app started out saying it was a 5.4m just ENE of Wakita, then corrected three hours later, showing it to be a 4.5m near Medford, which is SSW of Wakita.  If you expect people to continue to use your app, please fix these data errors. Otherwise, I will find one that IS accurate from the start.
replyContent: There is always a trade-off between fast reporting and accuracy. At first a fully automatic solution is reported, therefore errors may occur. Only later is verified by seismologists and updated to more accurate parameters. Thank you for your understanding.
app_name: Earthquakes Tracker

content: I really like this app. It has more than I need, as I only need one emergency category. I'm a psychologist, and this allows my clients to text a code to me if they are in crisis. But, if I wanted to set another tune to play if my child's phone contacted me, I could. It works fine, it's reasonably simple, even for a technological dinosaur like me. And, when I needed help with the app, Ryan, the builder, emailed me back within a few hours, and gave me very clear instructions on what I needed to do.
replyContent: Hi Beth, many thanks for your review, glad we got your issue sorted!
app_name: Emergency Alert

content: Very nice app that works as advertised and is a very good replacement for the Fire Alert app. Would love to see the options to only play the alert for a limited amount of time, during a specific time window, and to not do the audio if the phone is in use or is in silent mode.
replyContent: Thank you for your review! Rule schedules will be in the next release, coming in the new year! Also have the other two on the to do list 👍
app_name: Emergency Alert

content: Hi, had to replace fire alarm 2 as it was flagged for reading personal information. Purchased this app and it works great, as advertised. I would recommend it as a replacement for other alert apps 👍

app_name: Emergency Alert

content: I can't access or update to the new 3 words app on my Samsung tablet? I've even uninstalled the 'old' app and downloaded the 'new' one but its not actually the new app, just the original?!?
replyContent: Sorry to hear that! Unfortunately, we are no longer able to support devices that do not have telephony functionality, like tablets. This is due to policy updates on Google Play, for devices that are not supported, we can only offer the original App, sorry for this inconvenience.
app_name: Emergency Plus

content: Hi there. Had this App for several years now.The App appearance and "look" has changed recently and since this has happened, the App will not open on my Android phone. Dissapointing as I work in Care/Sports Training field and often am required to ring 000 to get assistance for injured sports people. Hope it works before my local AFL pre-season starts again in late November. Please, please get it fixed.
replyContent: Thank you for letting us know we had a glitch, and sorry for this inconvenience. We have now fixed the issue. Please update to the latest version on the Google Play Store. If you experience any further issues please contact us at TripleZero@fire.nsw.gov.au for additional help.
app_name: Emergency Plus

content: I am using Android 7 and it doesn't work for me following the update to PLUS.

app_name: Emergency Plus

No blizzard warnings (had 3 with the app), no thunderstorm warnings (had at least 20 of those with the app), no severe wind warning (had too many of those to count). With the gps turned on, it located my house on the map instantly. IDK how I can trust this app to download again. using weatherbug. I get alerts from them all the time. At least THEY are reliable.

Additionally, users were recently experiencing sporadic alert delivery. Our team believes we have fixed the bug. We rely on feedback from our users to improve the performance of the FEMA App & hope you will reconsider.

content: App is utter rubbish. For the last year or so I have been noticed of every major quake in a 500 km radius. Today's tremors in Croatia are really close, I can feel some of them, notices come in. When I click them the app is stone dead. Opening the app does not help either. Wonder who payed for that? One week later: I felt another quake M5 or so in the same region. No notice, more than a hour later app says "no quakes in vicinity". I am not going to keep an app not fulfilling it's basic purpose.
replyContent:
We do apologize: this is due to overload linked to quake in Croatia. We're continuously improving our IT & plan to move to the Cloud, but takes time. Please keep in mind we're a not for profit NGO offering free & ad-free services, so our means are limited Stay safe and be sure we're frustrated too
UPDATE: Does it work now?
app_name: LastQuake

content: It is great, but sometimes I can't see anything on the screen when I open the app

content: I don't leave my locations on all the time. Please allow your app to let users: 1.Turn on locations 2. App update and retain that location under the users profile, then that will allow users not to have to leave his/her locations on always. I would like the ability to just enter a zipcode for this app to retain my location, instead of always having my locations setting turned on.
replyContent: Hello Francesca, ZIP codes do not exist at global scale and we provide global services. Furthermore, ZIP codes are not accurate enough for crowdsourcing data. If you are concerned by privacy: we're a not for profit NGO offering free & ad-free services and we do not sell any data (see https://www.emsc-csem.org/service/application/#transparency)
app_name: LastQuake

content: An excellent well thought out app, that I use all the time. Living in Turkey it's unfortunate that its needed so much. The scale of the event may prompt a tsunami warning. No apps can give a warning of a quake. No early warnings exist, but some are timely enough and sensitive enough to alert you as soon as one starts. The internet is faster than a shockwave and if distant, you may get a head start on the quake. This app doesn't claim to do that, but it's a solid reliable app.
replyContent: Thanks Simon, you know quite well seismology, making your appreciation even more valuable. Greatly appreciated. Thanks and stay safe
app_name: LastQuake

content: Very helpful app, warnings&tips are accurate and sometimes the only things we have not to be so afraid.
replyContent: Thank you Gordana and stay safe
app_name: LastQuake

content: Amazingly fast at reporting. I felt a quake, immediately lifted my phone and tapped the app and Lastquake was already showing it. Very useful information too from others who felt it.
replyContent: Thank you Gordon. LastQuake can indeed be very fast thanks to its users! Stay safe
app_name: LastQuake

content: Very helpfull appliacation. Please add time duration of earthquake if you can.
replyContent:
Hello Roland, If you read the comments on the app, you'll see that for the same earthquake and same eyewitnesses location, reported duration can be very different. 
Duration s not easy at all to evaluate, It depends on the mag epicentral distance, local geology, eyewitnesses position (indoor/outdoor etc). In short we cannot do it. Sorry for this
app_name: LastQuake

content: Definitely alerts you as to eq over a certain measurement and is within a close distance to your location, within minutes
replyContent: Thanks Stephanie and Stay safe

content: Vert quick updates
replyContent: Thank you

content: Excelent reaponse and precision. Sometimes app crashes when trying to update live reports

Thank you Tomislav You're correct, services can be slow because of HUGE traffic generated by Zagreb earthquake. We apologize.
Please keep in mind we're a not for profit NGO offering free & ad-free services. We need external funding to maintain and develop our services and good rating is the best way to secure them. Thank you for your understanding
app_name: LastQuake

content: Alerts are not immediate. You receive the alert normally within 15 minutes of the earthquake occurence. Other than that is a very good application.
replyContent: Hello José, It isn't incorrect but incomplete. If you feel an earthquake and open the app, it has every chance to be already reported (typically within 20 to 90s see our pinned tweet)Notifications are only sent when these early detections are seismically confirmed. For small quakes, we rely on local network (up to 15 min), for big ones 7-9 min. Tks
app_name: LastQuake

content: It is great! I appreciate knowing the latest earthquake activity!
replyContent: Thank you Melissa
app_name: LastQuake

content: Have had this app for a short period of time, thus the rating. LastQuake up to this point has been AWESOME! In another few months or so, I'd like to opine again on the rating. If applicable, at that time, will rate accordingly. Selected more for "LastQuake" forecasting, than anything else. I do recommend this app at this time.
replyContent: Hello Joseph, what's about a 5-star rating today for a "AWESOME" app and revising your rating later :-)? Beyond teh joke, we're a not for profit NGO offering free and ad-free services and rely on external funding to maintain and develop them. And good rating is essential to secure these fundings. Thanks for your understanding
app_name: LastQuake

content: On time
replyContent: Thank you
app_name: LastQuake

content: It's actually pretty slow and keep crashing.

app_name: LastQuake

app_name: LastQuake

content: I am in Haiti currently and surprised at how fast the app updated on the earthquakes I felt. Really helpful to get the info so fast.

content: It's cool, but it could use a bit of speed optimization, sometimes it lags/stutters on list load.
replyContent: Thank you. It is a bandwith issue, there is not much we can do on our side. Thanks for your understanding
app_name: LastQuake

content: It's fine for basic info but it's not nearly as good as the website. The maps are not detailed enough and the 'near me' section doesn't show every single earthquake. But it's the best app of its type.

app_name: LastQuake

app_name: LastQuake

content: I love the timer feature that is easy to use and alerts your contacts fast if you need help! And the other methods are great too, such as just swiping down!

content: Update: The developers fixed the bug and its working well! I am impressed with how promt they were and how efficient they were at fixing the timer! This app has been a big help in keeping me connected with friends and family when in sketchy situations. I highly recommend this app to anyone in need of a safety net. please can you email info@mysosfamily.com.

content: Wow, this app is so useful! I find it very necessary especially when you have older people in your family u sometimes need to look after. You just add the number!
replyContent:
We are pleased that you enjoyed the app. If there is anything we can do for you, just let us know at Info@mysosfamily.com!
Have a wonderful day!
app_name: My SOS Family

content: Well, had an earthquake a bit ago, and the alert did work.
replyContent: Glad to hear it!
app_name: MyShake

content: Never fast, always 10-30 minutes after the event
replyContent: Hello, this is the expected behavior. Our notifications page addresses this under the "Recent Earthquake Events" section and says "Events may take a few minutes to hours to arrive." This happens because there's some processing time from USGS sending us the earthquake data and then us sending it out to our users via MyShake app. We hope this helps!
app_name: MyShake

content: Does not work as claimed. Few minutes after I felt a 5.5 earthquake in San Diego, nothing shows up on this app. I cannot even register that I felt it. Turned on my Ham radio and I hear a lot of communication about the earthquake just like the earthquake in 2010. My other earthquake app reported the epicenter to be in Mexico, while MyShake app has no info until much later. Quite useless, I'm uninstalling it now.
replyContent: Hello, thanks for reaching out. We're sorry that MyShake did not report the earthquake as quickly as you had expected it to. It's very common for MyShake to not issue any notifications (different from alerts) for quakes around the world any time from minutes to hours, time varies each time due to processing information from USGS. Hope this helps.
app_name: MyShake

content: I had the same app on my old phone and it showed lower than 3.5 magnitude quake
replyContent: Hi, thanks for reaching out. Unfortunately, that was an older version. We found that the global catalog that we pull from is not reliably complete below M3.5, and in some places not even below M4.5 so our solution was to raise the level until we can start pulling from more local catalogs to give people a better experience. Hope this helps!
app_name: MyShake

content: All I get are notifications with coordinates. There should be an option to tap the notification and see the alert location on a map!! Lots of bugs that need fixing.
replyContent: Hi, we are sorry about this. The coordinates are coming directly from Google maps and usually they indicate an unknown location or a location near/in the ocean. We're trying to find a better way to report location from our end and hope to remove the coordinate formatting soon. Also, please make the latest update as it fixes the notification bug.
app_name: MyShake

content: Not proven yet, too much extraneous information. Needs the ability to filter seismic events by distance, magnitude and time. We don't need to see events from the Philippines or Japan or Alaska. And we should be able to filter by magnitude. The early warning had not been proven yet.
replyContent: Hi, if you're speaking about seeing earthquakes on the map with a filter, you're able to do so if you click on the "filter" button on the main screen (Recent tab page). This filter lets you filter by selecting the time range and the minimum magnitude. Also, the global notifications can be turned off if you're finding them bothersome. Thank you.
app_name: MyShake

content: Major Location/GPS battery drainer or other cause drainer. Seems like a great app but despite what the app reads-- IT IS A BATTERY DRAINER!! I even turned the battery drainer on and it still drains like a sieve. I have a Galaxy 8. My phone is not that old. In either way the app itself looks like it would be wonderful it's just I can't use it as it draims 40%-50% of my battery in a typical day [avg day is 25% use alone before]. If it drains the battery this much the app is really not much use.
replyContent: Hi, we are sorry for the inconvenience, we suggest turning on Battery Saving Mode in the app settings, this should help with the battery consumption. Please note, battery drainage is also more frequent on older Android phones or Samsung Galaxy devices. Also, we are looking into other solutions to save battery life, please stay tuned for an update!
app_name: MyShake

content: Glad the app exists, but even on a Google Pixel 3XL this app is almost 15% of my phone's battery use. It eats up more battery in the background than my foreground apps use. With this running in the background my phone's battery barely lasts 6 hours, so I've had to stop it running in the background which delays notifications and makes the app pretty useless as an early warning system.
replyContent: Hi, we are sorry for the inconvenience, we suggest turning on Battery Saving Mode in the app settings, this should help with the battery consumption. The notifications and early warning alerts should reach you still. Also, we are looking into other solutions to save battery life, please stay tuned for an update!
app_name: MyShake

content: Drained 57% of my battery in three hours, had to uninstall. I am a geologist and a data scientist and could not be more in support of this effort, but how can it be used this way? One extra star because I love you
replyContent: Hi, we agree that the battery drain is problematic for many people and we're looking into a solution that reduces battery consumption. In the meantime, have you tried having your phone on battery saving mode? This helps a little. Thank you for using MyShake and please email us at myshake-info@berkeley.edu if anything else comes up!
app_name: MyShake

content: Battery hog! I downloaded today and watched my battery percentage drop from 100% to 45% in just a few hours while the phone wasn't in use.
replyContent: We are sorry for the inconvenience, we suggest turning on Battery Saving Mode in the app settings, this should help with the battery consumption. Please note, battery drainage is also more frequent on older Android phones.

content: battery drain! Completely useless, as my phone would be dead and never alert me anyway. Drain half my battery in 2 hrs on a new note 10. eff that.

content: Way to many ads.  Resize; ad.  Change settings; ad.  Pan; ad.  Zoom;ad.  Every 20 seconds; ad.... And these full page ads are in addition to a bottom banner ad...   Everyone who complains about this gets a completely canned response from Apalon so that just tells me Apalon won't make changes and isn't listening.  If it weren't for the ad frequency I'd rate it much higher (5).  In its current state I'd rate it (2), but I'm giving it (1) star because of Apalon's canned responses to all PREVIOUS reviews that note this absurd ad frequency.    Let's see how they respond to me because I think that my advice to them to tone the ads down is legitimate considering. If they acknowledge that I'll reevaluate my review rating and I'll bump my review to (2).  I'll bump to a (5) once ads are actually served at a "normal free version rate."   Finally, as a developer myself, I get it, the free version has ads and there needs to be a catalyst to upgrade.  That said, the frequency is just too high; obscenely high.  If I can't evaluate the app experience without getting served an ad every 10-20 seconds I won't upgrade and will just find an alternative.    Case in point, my friend's Google gadgets made him 60k a year in revenue with just 180k passive users back in the day (mid 2000s).  Tone the ads down and you'll likely get more free users and therefore ad revenue.  Treat us like the goose that laid the golden egg and we'll just dump the app.  I'll keep evaluating, but it's Weather Channel until then...

content: I was hoping to know what's happening more in my area and have it populate on the map. Do I have too many options or not enough to get the app to work? Idk. User ability they need a better overview video than the one they already have.
replyContent: Hi KY- A special CPR-needed alert will be sent if a person near you is reported in cardiac arrest. It does not require you to pick it from the incident list. We believe it's explained clearly in the video here (not sure if this is the one you mention): https://vimeo.com/413764254 . If it's still unclear, please contact us at support@pulsepoint.org
app_name: PulsePoint Respond

content: Quickly updated with basic info. I hear sirens and can immediately check to see where they are going and to what kind of event. Just wish there was updated info also given. For example, if the response was to a fire, is the fire still going? Is it out? What's the containment?
replyContent: Hi Kelly- We get our data directly from agency CAD systems. This has the advantage of being immediate, but does not collect much detail beyond status of units dispatched.  That said, as once the incident (fire) moves from the Active to the Recent section, it is complete. Things like containment and damage must come from other agency sources.
app_name: PulsePoint Respond

content: I wish I could see more than one department at a time instead of toggling back and forth

app_name: PulsePoint Respond

app_name: PulsePoint Respond

content: Keeps closing when trying to open incident. App is usually pretty good, but lately it completely sucks.
replyContent: Charles- Google Maps API had an outage this afternoon that affected thousands of apps that use it. Unfortunately this corrupted our app settings. Please follow the steps here to restore PulsePoint: https://www.pulsepoint.org/2020/04/23/maps-crash-04232020/
app_name: PulsePoint Respond

content: App lets me know responding vehicles and general address and map. As a responder, there have been times where the radio traffic through PulsePoint was all I could hear. Very comforting to have that backup! Love it.
replyContent: Hi Lynda-  Coverage depends on the agency's jurisdiction.  Usually we recommend that large counties split their feeds into smaller divisions, but this only works well with high population density areas.
app_name: PulsePoint Respond

content: 12/21/19: The audio times out (turns off) after several minutes on android 9 & 10. Also have to tap speaker icon to get live audio... UPDATE: PulsePoint developer responded to my issue and resolved my problem - App notification alert is about 30 seconds before the emergency is dispatched. Perfect for emergency responders.
replyContent: Jesse- Glad things are working for you now.
app_name: PulsePoint Respond

content: The incident happened at 2:15 and at 2:48 I am getting the alert of the incident needs to be fixed
replyContent: Richard- contact us at support@pulsepoint.org with the incident details (agency, calltype, time) and we'll investigate. Many times a call will start as a non-alertable type and then transition later. Resulting in the discrepancy.
app_name: PulsePoint Respond

content: Not many options to set customizable alerts, or to change different settings.
replyContent: Demetre- Alerts are fully customizable. Go to your settings app an select Apps & notifications _ PulsePoint _ Notifications. Each notification type can be fully customized.
app_name: PulsePoint Respond

content: very slow to respond, map mode is very glitchy... im on an android os and the app displays VERY delayed compared to what my actual dispatch tells me... notifications are a not customizable and often dont push through until i have to manually update/refresh app... there seems to be no difference between CPR request and MEDICAL aid?!?!?!? I will keep playing with app see if anything gets easier [7.22.3019]
replyContent: Joel- Incident delay is dependent on agency. Notifications are different than the incident view. They are pushed to your device into your notifications dropdown. The incident view in the app is pull to refresh. A CPR needed alert is a separate type of notification that presents a full assist view if you are within 1/4 mi of an SCA event.
app_name: PulsePoint Respond

content: My county uses this system for 1st responders. Normally pulse point will alert me before tones drop.. click on the alert and it gets directions for you. Works 99.9999% of the time. Ad free. Works flawless on both iPhones and android.
replyContent: Michael- Thanks for your updated review. Please download the latest 4.5 version. Lots of neat new functionality we hope you'll like.
app_name: PulsePoint Respond

content: I like this app. i think the sound notification needs to be different. i dont always hear it. sometimes this app wont alert me at all.
replyContent: If you are on Android 8 or 9. You can change the notification sound in the notification section of the 'Apps & notifications' for PulsePoint in your device's 'Settings' app.
app_name: PulsePoint Respond

content: Its really great however the times from 2100 hrs to 0600 hrs its dark on every FD I follow. Every so often ill get alerts during those hours but very seldom even when there should be a call on the screen as i monitor my scanner and calls are dispatched over the air but again not on the app.
replyContent: Reg- We do not mask any calls during any time of the day or night.  As long as the call is not tagged as a public hazzard or a HIPAA issue, it will be displayed.
app_name: PulsePoint Respond

content:
It would be nice to have have a way to change the alert tone on the app and 
to also make it a little louder. Also it would be nice to know what kind of 
emergency it is. Medical emergency can be anything. Other than that it is a 
good app. I like it
replyContent:
Jeff-
Version 4.0 of the app is now in progressive rollout in the Play Store (should be fully rolled out by Mon Sept. 24th).  It  allows you you to change notification sounds (if you are running Android 8 or higher). Sorry, we cannot identify the nature of medical calls because of HIPAA regulations.
app_name: PulsePoint Respond

content: It's excellent, but has limited filtering.  Clutters the dislay with useless information of events that happened hours ago or the day before.
replyContent: Hi John- The incident display shows 100 incidents or 24 hours, whichever is fewer/less. In busy agencies, that can mean incidents clearing in a few hours, while in smaller jurisdictions, incidents can show for a day.
app_name: PulsePoint Respond

content: Alerts are delayed by atleast 8 minutes..most longer.
replyContent: Chris-  This depends on the agency CAD to PulsePoint interface feed.  Most agencies send us incident data before dispatchers assign crews and PulsePoint sends alerts immediately.  Some agencies do have more delay than we'd like. Contact us at developer@pulsepoint.org with the agency(s) you are following, and we'll investigate.
app_name: PulsePoint Respond

content: I was okay with this app until the RCMP sent out 6 false alerts in one evening. I have PTSD and receiving a notice to close my blinds and lock my doors is extremely triggering. The alert was actually for a community over 4 hours away... So deleting this because the other notifications are so often and so redundant you have to turn them off. I only want to hear about ACTUAL emergencies.
replyContent: Thank you for your review and we apologize that this was triggering for you. Did you know that within the settings of the app you can choose what type of alerts you receive (although critical alerts are mandatory)? Please contact us at http://emergencyalert.saskatchewan.ca if you need help adjusting the settings to better suit your needs.
app_name: Saskatchewan Emergency Alert

content: Awesome, fast and updated very quickly.
replyContent: Thank you for your review and rating!
app_name: Saskatchewan Emergency Alert

content: Beeps for the same alert 4 times in one day ( heat warning ) 2 is good enough
replyContent: Thank you for your review and rating! Weather alerts are sent from Environment and Climate Change Canada and we have no control over when they send them. We apologize for this.
app_name: Saskatchewan Emergency Alert

content: I spend more time trying to get this app to work properly. The ladt alert from the police about a 4 year old. Will not clear so know I keep hearing the alert going off thought out the day and night. It will not uninstall completly. If you can not keep it working please get rid of it
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback Leona. Sorry to hear the SaskAlert app is not meeting your expectations. We'll be happy to assist you with this issue.
app_name: Saskatchewan Emergency Alert

content: I really depend on this app. As it keeps me update. On alerts.
replyContent: Thank you for your rating and review Betty. Glad you like using SaskAlert. Please recommend it to your friends and family. Stay Safe
app_name: Saskatchewan Emergency Alert

content: Far too many alerts, some repetitive. People will stop paying attention
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback Carol. Sorry to hear the SaskAlert app is not meeting your expectations. Please send us an email at saskalert@gov.sk.ca with details of the repetitive alerts and we will be happy to look into this for you. We hope you continue to use the SaskAlert app.
app_name: Saskatchewan Emergency Alert

content: Has worked to provide alerts.
replyContent: Thank you for your rating and review Duncan. We are please that you enjoy the SaskAlert App.
app_name: Saskatchewan Emergency Alert

content: Gives me the large general area at a glance. Makes it easier/faster for travel decisions.
replyContent: Thank you for your rating and review Judy. Glad that you like the SaskAlert app. Please recommend it to your friends.
app_name: Saskatchewan Emergency Alert

content: Sometimes seems to be a bit slow in giving alerts.
replyContent: Thank you for your rating and review Lawrence. We hope you continue to use the SaskAlert app
app_name: Saskatchewan Emergency Alert

content: a little slow in sending alerts. we already had what was predicted
replyContent: Thank you for your rating and feedback Penny. We hope you continue to use the SaskAlert app.
app_name: Saskatchewan Emergency Alert

content: very helpful app to keep you updated on weather
replyContent: Thank you for your review and rating Josée. Glad you like the SaskAlert app.
app_name: Saskatchewan Emergency Alert

content: I find this app very useful, it's nice to know what's coming in terms of weather, and for Amber alerts etc.
replyContent: Thank you for your rating and review. Glad to hear you find the SaskAlert app useful for all types of events.
app_name: Saskatchewan Emergency Alert

content: It took you nearly 5 hours to notify us of the current power outage.
replyContent: The decision to issue an alert rests the local authorities. Sorry that the power outage alert was not issued when expected.
app_name: Saskatchewan Emergency Alert

content:
Tried loading latest version it will download but will not install. My 
phone reboots some time during the install and when I go back to play store 
it shows as an available update.
replyContent: Sorry to hear that the latest version of the SaskAlert app is not working for you. We believe this problem is now fixed. If it is fixed to your satisfaction and you wished to change your review and rating, we would be thankful.
app_name: Saskatchewan Emergency Alert

content: Does not give accurate weather alerts and I am a skywarn storm spotter
replyContent: Your previous review was positive and I would like to understand what happened. For which region in which country is this exactly? Was there a warning missing? Please note that the app shows the warnings of the local national weather service and they decide when a weather conditions justifies a warning, not the app itself. micha@severe-weather.app
app_name: Severe Weather! (weather warnings)

content: used to be pretty good- now CodeRed/Smart 911 is all "LookOut!" ? I find out on the news? the company didn't send anything? and I'm getting alerts for nothing near me (yes I have checked my location radius!) and I can't delete the alert/ msgs?! Do I need to delete app and re-install? oy! I live in High Wildfire area. Not "stay indoors- police activity due to armed person activity"..
replyContent: I'm sorry the app isn't working as expected. Please feel free to contact techsupport@ravemobilesafety.com to open a support ticket. Hopefully it is just a small settings issue.
app_name: Smart 911

content: No support! The app says I received several alerts. I only have received 1. I can't get.
replyContent: Hi, we're sorry to hear that and we would love to take a look at the issue. Please reach out to our customer support team at techsupport@ravemobilesafety.com.
app_name: Smart 911

content: Very good for the time being, very competitive to people who have to challenge themselves to use their training skills by reconnect with memory loss.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback.
app_name: SoSecure: Personal Safety. Live Emergency Response

content: I am quite impressed with this company. They pull out all the stops when it comes to customer service. They're more aware of where I am than I am sometimes. I can make my deliveries with the knowledge that I'm not alone, there's someone watching out for me in case I need help of any kind. Quick and thourough response every time. I highly recommend SoSecure for any one who needs the peace of mind for theirself and loved ones that they have help right now in case of trouble.
replyContent: Thank you so much for your review!- Mazen
app_name: SoSecure: Personal Safety. Live Emergency Response

content: I by mistake slid SOS and respond was timely
replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to write a review :-)
app_name: SoSecure: Personal Safety. Live Emergency Response

content: During set up asked me to pay 1.49 a month for what used to be free in the kxxv app also by ew scrips. Im sad to hear the kxxv app is discontinued for an app that is has many of the same features locked and bundled with over 100 new features. I think i only used 15 of the possible 60 features in the old app. I have no questions forea scipps, but they have lost me and i choose to longer watch their weather or news, going to Gray media CBS KWTX... Cant wait until Nielsen rating time.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're not pleased with the app. Our customer service team is here to answer any questions you have. Feel free to submit a support ticket in the app at anytime so we can help answer any questions.
app_name: Storm Shield

content: Don't Bother Installing This App. This app lacks a lot of the helpful options that were available in the KRIS TV Weather app. Weather news broadcasts are not updated or current. If I miss my local news broadcast then I'm S.O.L. when it comes to the weather. I believe this app will be very unreliable if there is a tropical event for my area. If anything changes with this app I will update my review. 7/12/2019
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're not pleased with the updated app. Our customer service team is here to answer any questions you have, and help with any differences between the old app and Storm Shield App. Feel free to submit a support ticket to our Customer Support Team from within the app at anytime.
app_name: Storm Shield

content: I love it because you can get the weather faster
replyContent: Thank you for letting us know Storm Shield App is working well for you!
app_name: Storm Shield

content: I like the way it alerts me by saying it out loud and I can look at the alert right away
replyContent: Great to hear how the app is meeting your weather alerting needs, thanks!
app_name: Storm Shield

content: I paid for and downloaded this app several years ago.  It worked great and I was very happy with it.  Then, E.W. Scripps decided it needed changing.  Ever since then, it's been one bug after another.  It is now a cumbersome and over priced product that does not work as well as the original.  For the last couple of years, I haven't been able to read or hear notifications.  My map, even though I have it set at the most sensitive level, never opens up to my location.  On top of all that, it keeps prompting me to pay for the app all over again.  It would seem that EWS may be looking for a way to mess this app up like it is turning their formerly well respected TV news outlets into second rate training grounds for relatively inexperienced "journalists".  I'm looking for a new weather app, that works.
replyContent: Sorry to hear you're unhappy with the new app. The tech that powered the old app was discontinued in 2017. Due to the change, the app had to either be rebuilt or discontinued. We made the decision to continue the product. Our customer service team is compiling feedback so we can continue improving the app, so plz submit a support ticket in the app.
app_name: Storm Shield

content:
It was once a pretty useful app. I live in tornado alley, so receiving up 
to the minute alerts is very important to me. However, I'm not at all 
pleased with the new direction/business model this app has adopted. For an 
app, which required me to purchase to begin with, it certainly doesn't make 
me happy there I'm now expected to pay a monthly subscription fee to gain 
access to features that other weather apps offer for free. I'm not planning 
to use this app anymore in future. I'm in no mood to pay a subscription for 
something I'd already paid for.
replyContent: You do NOT need to pay extra to get alerts, currents, hourly/daily forecasts. There are NEW features you get for FREE that were not in the old app (see Weather Layers). Two NEW features, Future Weather (unlocks future radar, storm tracks) & Lightning (unlocks Lightning notifications), are OPTIONAL paid features. FAQ: http://bit.ly/SS-AndroidFAQ
app_name: Storm Shield

content: New version sucks. Please bring back the old version.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're not pleased with this release. Our customer service team is compiling a list of all feedback that we receive and is reviewing it with our development team so we can continue to improve the app. If you're having trouble finding anything in the app, our support team is happy to help. Just submit a support ticket in the app.
app_name: Storm Shield

content: The old version was a lot more user friendly. The new version is not nearly as good. Harder to use, and I refuse to pay anything more for the app or its content.
replyContent: You do NOT need to pay extra to get alerts, currents, hourly/daily forecasts. There are NEW features you get for FREE that were not in the old app (see Weather Layers). Two NEW features, Future Weather (unlocks future radar, storm tracks) & Lightning (unlocks Lightning notifications), are optional paid features. FAQ: http://bit.ly/SS-AndroidFAQ
app_name: Storm Shield

content: Hate the new update!! Not worth buying anymore!!!
replyContent: We're sorry to hear you're not pleased with this release. Our customer service team is compiling a list of all feedback that we receive and is reviewing it with our development team so we can continue to improve the app. If you're having trouble finding anything in the app, our support team is happy to help. Just submit a support ticket in the app.
app_name: Storm Shield

content: This update is awful. There is barely any information provided. Why do I have to zoom into my location everytime I opened the app? I feel like I need to find another app that works better. Fox18 weather app is a possibility since you've made this one completely useless.
replyContent: Alerts, hourly & 7day forecasts still exist. Tap a Location's pin on the map to see its current conditions, hourly forecast, and 7-day forecast. We're working on a fix for the map view issue you mentioned.
app_name: Storm Shield

content: This app was great once.. now your trying trying to charge me fee for damn lighting alert I don't want??  WTH??
replyContent: Alerts, hourly & 7day forecasts still exist. There are NEW features you don't have to pay for which were not in the old app: Clouds/Radar together on map; Wind Speed; Snow Cover; Temp. Map; Water Temp. Map; Road Weather. Two NEW features not in the old app, Future Weather (future radar, storm tracks) & Lightning, are subscription-based & optional.
app_name: Storm Shield

content: Loved this app before the latest update. Not user friendly
replyContent: We apologize that you are unhappy about the update. If you feel there is something missing that was in the previous version and is not free in this version, please let us know by filing a Support ticket from within your Storm Shield App and we’ll be happy to look into it.
app_name: Storm Shield

content: I like the old version better
replyContent: We apologize that you are unhappy about the update. If you feel there is something missing that was in the previous version and is not free in this version, please let us know by filing a Support ticket from within your Storm Shield App and we’ll be happy to look into it.
app_name: Storm Shield

content: I loved storm shield until the last update.. After paying good money for the app awhile back, now they're only showing current radar and a short loop and if you want more, it's in app purchases!
replyContent: Tap Location pins on map to see current conditions/forecast. There are several NEW features you get for FREE that were not available in the old app: view Clouds/Radar together on the map; Wind Speed; Snow Cover; Temp. Map; Water Temp. Map; Road Weather. Two new features, Future Weather & Lightning Strikes, are subscription-based.
app_name: Storm Shield

content: When the new update got pushed out, I was very confused. I had no clue how to find the weather data in my area. I was under the impression that I had to pay a new subscription to get the old features I had. However, it just turned out that I needed to click on the pin in on the map for my location, and it brought up my weather information. There should have been a tutorial pushed with the new update.   I really like the new satellite image feature. It looks great. However, I still think the old UI was easier to use. Sometimes, I don't want to have to look at the map to choose between locations. This new version needs some tweaking, but I think it has some great potential!
replyContent: You are correct -- we should have provided a tip to help users understand how to see current conditions and hourly/daily forecasts. We are working on adding this to our next update, along with some additional bug fixes. Thank you for your feedback!
app_name: Storm Shield

content: If you have to explain how to get to something on an upgrade that was READILY APPARENT in an old version, your UI design failed.  I don't care about a slick map. I want my local forecast not hidden behind a pin in the map. Really bad.
replyContent: Tap Location pins on the map to see its current conditions & forecasts. There are several NEW features you get for FREE that were not available in the old app: view Clouds & Radar together on the map; Wind Speed; Snow Cover; Temperature Map; Water Temperature Map; Road Weather. Two new features, Future Weather & Lightning Strikes, are subscriptions
app_name: Storm Shield

content: I think everyone is ranting abt the change of this app thinking they were getting "future" forecasts before....it takes a while to figure out the new GUI, but all in all, it's pretty decent....can still see the "future" hourly forecasts for planning days....everybody just needs to settle down a little and refigure the app out since it is different than the older version....and I'm liking this newer version.
replyContent: Thank you for your comments and kind words!
app_name: Storm Shield

content: update and add some India numbers
replyContent: Hey Pravin, Thank you for your suggestions. We have already all the India numbers in the app. If anyone is missing please do let us know!
app_name: Travel Safe- World Emergency Phone Numbers

content: Widespread odiferous grey smoke a full 18 hours before any alert issued for 'community health air quality'. Said smoke was reason I installed app. If this is the timeliness we can expect, why bother with this so far fully useless app? Edit 28/3 once again, for several days, smoke everywhere. visibility is very low. It stinks. Again, no notification on app until days later. Pointless app. NOTIFY SOONER! No, I won't visit some website- that's the app's for!
replyContent:
Good morning. Warnings are not sent for all planned burns, unless air quality becomes an issue. The warning was issued for Melbourne yesterday when that become the case.
If you would like to keep informed of planned burns that are occurring or coming up, you can do so on the Forest Fire Management website: https://plannedburns.ffm.vic.gov.au/
-SM
app_name: Vic Emergency

content: This is still the worst app ever. It never alerts to fires, atm it says 12 incidents but look at the map and there is only 1. It refuses to shrink the monitored area. Its locked to 10km. Today something about sheep graziers....well im in the suburbs and no sheep here. Ive turned off that alert so why am i getting it? Where is dark mode? * thanks for the earthquake alert 1.5 hours AFTER. Thats really quick for you. Useless alerts way after the incident.
replyContent: Hi Rik, thanks for raising these concerns. We have recorded your concerns. If you continue to have issues you can raise them here: https://vicemergency.zendesk.com/hc/en-gb/requests/new Amy
app_name: Vic Emergency

content: i hav this app on my ph in general and its been g8 for latest updates on all emergencies 👍👍♍

Hi Martine, 
Thank you for getting in touch with us to provide your valued feedback. We have passed your comments onto our developers.

Wolf

Hi Dave,

content: So good to keep you updated with all types of emergencies. Couldn't travel around Victoria without it.

content: Ridiculous how I get warnings for events hundreds of kms away from my watch zone. What alerts are in my area are vague or innacurate. Also costant alert repeats any wonder so many country people dont even bother looking at the alerts now. A typical Government propaganda site that is there to protect them from stupidity and litigation!!!
replyContent:
Hi,

Please could you let us know what incident you got a notification for so that we can investigate this for you.

If it was a severe weather warning then these cover whole districts so it's possible for the icon to show very far away from your watch zone on the map but the incident is still relevant.

Kind regards,
Layne

content: The old CFA app was better. Too many unnecessary alerts and notifications. The map function is clunky and difficult to navigate.
replyContent: We'd love to hear more about your experience and how we can help. Please log a support request here: http://support.emergency.vic.gov.au
app_name: Vic Emergency

content: There is great information here, fire and weather dangers but their notification system overwhelms with worthless data that will never affect you. I have a short range 20 km watch zone but because we are in "Gippsland" there are constant popups on severe weather in South, North, East Gippsland etc which are as helpful as knowing the weather in South America. The ACTUAL reports we are interested in get lost in all this chaff. The only way I can see to disable these is turn them off entirely!
replyContent: Although you can't turn off notifications for warnings, you can turn off Advice and Community Information messages. You can also switch off some or ALL incident notifications (there are a total of 46) by editing your watch zone.

content: Wanted for sometime now an app that shows both quakes and volcanos. Information provided is excellent. Thank you.

content: I've used & recommended WeatherBug for several years & it's my favorite, daily go-to weather app for many reasons (love the Spark Lightning option too!). However, after the latest update there are issues with the hourly forecast accuracy. For example: It is raining in my area now (that includes the nearest weather station too) and the hourly shows 0% rain/precipitation. The map shows rain so I don't know what the issue is? Hoping it's fixed soon because I depend on this app daily!
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. We’d like to know the details of the problem you mentioned. Please send the details or screenshot to weatherbug.android@gmail.com. We'll pass it along to our development team and see if there is any way we can improve it.

content: The app seems to work fine but WeatherBug has gone overboard on the alert status. It seems like everything sets off the warning alert. I have done adjustments but I still get tons of warnings. Dense fog, red flag, wind, or fire weather always seem to come up. Where is the setting for thunder storm and tornado watches and warnings? Weatherbug has set up too many things as warnings. Very disappointed on the alerts.

app_name: Weather by Weather Bug: Live Radar Map & Forecast

content: I'm sure it's accurate, but I constantly get notifications for the same weather alert sometimes two at the same time every 30 minutes or so. There aren't any options for minimalistic themes in notifications or within the app. There also is basically only two widget sizes: either a tiny little square or the entire effin page, no in-between, both of which aren't customizable or even resizable.

app_name: Weather by Weather Bug: Live Radar Map & Forecast

content: I have the same issues as another user in that the current local temp on Status Bar does not get updated consistently. WeatherBug support contacted me, and they've been great. Very responsive and willing to help. I ended up clearing cache and storage for the app, and this seems to have helped. I also ensured the app is set to 'never sleep'. The temp being updated on the status bar has improved somewhat - it may auto-update once or twice an hour now. This isn't a deal breaker for me, as I like the other features of the app.

app_name: Weather by Weather Bug: Live Radar Map & Forecast

content: Winter update in April?? What, is this an Australia app? We don't need snow forecasts when there's virtually no more chance of snow in the entire lower 49. How about RAIN forecasts? Something I can use people...

app_name: Weather by Weather Bug: Live Radar Map & Forecast

content: Not sure what happened to this app, but it is not as good as it used to be. Prime example, the main screen never matches the hourly forecast, not even close. Tonight: main screen says low of 40, the hourly forecast never goes below 59. It sends notices of rain in the next 15 minutes, but the radar (and the sky) are totally clear. I do like the layout, and the ease at which you can switch locales, but the accuracy has tanked. And feedback? Now all it does is ask you to share. Maybe they know.

Hello,
Your problem needs a more detailed examination. Please report it to our technical support team at weatherbug.android@gmail.com. We are always looking to help our users. -WeatherBug's Team
app_name: Weather by Weather Bug: Live Radar Map & Forecast

content: Fix your app. The thing I liked was the camaras for traffic before leaving don't seem to be able to find anymore. Set up location in phone settings and app but never stays.
replyContent: Hi Dee, You can find the traffic camera in commuter card. The only required is to turn on your GPS for it. Kindly share us more details at weatherbug.android@gmail.com if this doesn't work. Looking forward to help every user. Thanks- WeatherBug's Team
app_name: Weather by Weather Bug: Live Radar Map & Forecast

content: Not terrible, but not great either. The predictions are bad and unreliable. 0 percent chance of rain for nearly 24 hours, and a few hours later its raining.

content: CONTINUED UPDATE: I do appreciate air quality now being part of this app....I'm just still waiting for accuracy.  When I can sit on my bed and my son sit 2 rooms away in our Mobile home and it gives us 2 completely different forecasts there is a problem.  I could understand it if we lived in a castle, estate or plantation, but we are in a manufacturered home.  With tornado and hurricane seasons coming soon we need accuracy.  BTW, thank you for fixing the rate me issue.  Update.... Aug 15, 2016... I am still having the app ask me almost every time about rating.  I am going to take a leap that the problem will be fixed and raise my rTing to 3 stars because the app did not ask me to rate for over a month.  I love the app otherwise.           Previous update...I  am holding at 2 due to the fact this app never stops asking me to rate it.  I'm glad to see other issues have been resolved, however, I'm very sick of having to deal with rating every time I open the app.
replyContent:
Hi Dee! We are sorry to hear about your bad experience. We definitely want to look into this issue and make sure that it is corrected. Please send us an email to weatherbug.android@gmail.com so that we can understand the problem better and try to fix it for you. Thank you for your time. We appreciate your continued support.

-WeatherBug Team
app_name: Weather by Weather Bug: Live Radar Map & Forecast

content: Do not like this current update. The air quality is nice, but the option to order the catagories the way I want is gone. replyContent: Hi Shelli! We have listened to your feedback and we are happy to announce we have created a customization feature so you can re-order your weather data. Simply click on the blue button to the top right corner of the spotlight card and you can re-organize your feed. If you have any questions, please contact weatherbug.android@gmail.com.
app_name: Weather by Weather Bug: Live Radar Map & Forecast

If this doesn't resolve your issue, please let us know at android.support@weather.com
app_name: Weather radar and live maps - The Weather Channel

content: I do not like this latest update!!! Specifically the hourly forecast....it does not include the wind speed. I do not need a graph line across the day's temps nor do I need advertising thst tsked uo one third of the screen. Please go back to your signature blue background. It is so much easier to see the data. The new white background with the changing pink and green accents is not as user friendly.
replyContent:
Thanks for taking the time to write, and we're sorry to hear you don't love the new design. 

The changes were made to give users more weather information in less time. However, we agree new designs take time to get used to. We hope that you give us another try! 

If you have more feedback, you can reach us at android.support@weather.com.
app_name: Weather radar and live maps - The Weather Channel

content: Unfortunately I agree with the majority of the reviews after this new update. It is just terrible, it's gotten way too busy and clunky. You can no longer simply just scroll through to see what you need. Each different screen is a full swipe to reach and if you dont swipe fully enough for it, it reverts back to the screen you were on. White background is as stated by others just gross. I've found when reading through the forecasts I'm losing focus and forgetting what I've read for what day, and whether it is morning or evening. Seriously the delivery of the information has gotten really long and bulky. My biggest complaints by fair is the old hourly display where you could see practically the whole day laid out on your screen is gone. Now you have scroll across your screen and you dont see nearly as much at once. And lastly the getting rid of the 15 day forecast on one viewable screen might just be the straw that broke the camel's back for me. I keep seeing the developers say just "click the daily tab above the graph to see all 15 days at a glance." This not entirely accurate. Yes, all 15 days are there, but you have to swipe across your screen multiple times to see all 15 days. You don't see them all lined up together at once, so once again I'm finding I don't remember what the weather was like at the beginning of the week while looking at the end of the week. This app took a serious hit, I see alot of people are saying the developers need to revert back to the old app, or at least bring back certain features, and I couldnt agree more, dont let pride override the feedback alot of the people are giving. Thank you and good luck.
replyContent: Hi Nicholas, thanks for trying the new app and providing your thoughts. I hope you'll give us another shot this winter.
app_name: Weather radar and live maps - The Weather Channel

content: the app was working fine before the new version .it was easy to use and not much fluffing around with all the charts and so on . just bring back the old version otherwise its not gonna work .and by the way it crashes every time you open it

content: After latest update, widgets are stuck loading...  update 6-14-17 I got a notification recently that the app had been updated and to see if my original issues were resolved but ever since having those issues, i had re-installed the app several times and had not noticed any problems. Just recently though, my phone began to have problems sending/receiving text messages, browsing the internet and also was getting very hot for no reason. After a lot of troubleshooting, i was ready to reset my phone. I made a last ditch attempt to figure out what could be wrong and checked my phone's data usage. The app with the highest usage behind my mobile hotspot was the weather channel app. What?More data than my browser, than any streaming music? Culprit found and uninstalled. Text is now working fine and the phone is no longer getting hot. Thanks for eating up all my data weather channel. ZERO STARS if I could give that.
replyContent: Hello, we've released an updated version. Would you mind downloading the latest and let us know if you're still experiencing issues? Thanks for the heads up
